page.title: 16 Hemsworth Local Newspaper
page.content: The Express Newspaper began as a family business in the late nineteenth century. The family was called Hinchliffe. The paper was going well until a printing office offered a large amount of money to buy the newspaper. This larger concern at first covered the Hemsworth area and then expanded to include South Elmsall. They printed about 8,000 copies and now print 18,000. There are four people working in the office, three of whom are reporters, the other is the editor. The paper is printed in Wakefield and concentrates on local news events and distasteful and memorable stories.
